video.description:
Methi Malai Paneer made vegan with Tofu and Cashews. Tofu and Fenugreek/Greens in Creamy Sauce. 
FULL RECIPE: https://www.veganricha.com/2017/07/methi-malai-paneer-tofu-fenugreek-greens-creamy-sauce.html
MY BOOKS: https://veganricha.com/books

Easy Weeknight Restaurant style Indian entree. Serve over Naan or rice. Vegan Gluten-free Recipe. Soy-free Nut-free option. Methi Malai Matar (Fenugreek/Greens and peas in creamy white sauce), Methi malai paneer (fenugreek and Paneer cheese cubes in creamy sauce) are some Mughlai dishes you might find in some Indian restaurants. The dishes use malai or dairy cream and cheese or other dairy ingredients. Its like a spiced up Spinach dip, with lots of complex flavor!

But this version is free of all that, tastes amazing, and comes together quickly as well. Fresh fenugreek leaves are a favorite to use in the dish when in season. If you find some then definitely use them fresh, else use dried fenugreek with greens of choice. Serve with hot garlic Naan or rice/grains or make a bowl with roasted veggies, add to wraps or on a pizza.

recipeIngredient: 2 inch cinnamon stick (or add a heaping 1/4 tsp ground cinnamon later with the garam masala)
1/3 cup tomato puree  (or puree 1/2 heaping cup chopped tomato with a tbsp of water)
1/4 cup raw cashews (soaked in warm water for 15 minutes)
3/4 tsp salt or more to taste
1/2 tsp sugar or more to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Press the tofu for 10 minutes to remove excess moisture, then cube into small even pieces.
recipeInstructions.name: Press the tofu for 10 minutes to remove excess moisture, then cube into small even pieces.

recipeInstructions.text: Toss pressed tofu in oil. Mix the spices and starch and a small bowl, then add to tofu. Toss untill well coated. Bake on parchment lined sheet or greased baking dish at 400 degrees F / 200ºc for 15 to 20 minutes

itemListElement.text: Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. When hot add cumin, cloves and cinnamon and let them cook until cumin seeds change color.
itemListElement.name: Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. When hot add cumin, cloves and cinnamon and let them cook until cumin seeds change color.

itemListElement.text: Add onion, garlic, ginger and chile and cook until translucent. Add pureed tomato and cook for 3 to 4 minutes.
itemListElement.name: Add onion, garlic, ginger and chile and cook until translucent. Add pureed tomato and cook for 3 to 4 minutes.

itemListElement.text: Meanwhile, blend the cashews with water until smooth (or use premade cashew cream and add some non dairy milk). Or blend 1/4 cup silken tofu or non dairy yogurt + 1 tbsp flour with non dairy milk. Too many options :)

itemListElement.text: Add the ground spices, greens and fenugreek leaves, salt and sugar and mix well. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes or until the greens are wilting. Add cashew milk to the pan. Bring to a boil. Taste and adjust salt, heat, spice and sweet. Add more non dairy milk if too thick.

itemListElement.text: Add in the baked tofu and let it simmer for 2 minutes. Serve hot with Naan or rice or make an Indian Bowl with chutney or pickled onion, cooked grains, garam masala roasted veggies.
